A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Makes it a mission to detract from the decent "Force Awakens".
Stupifying amount of plotholes. Weird pacing. 
Humor which seems completely out of place.
Story-arcs of characters are underwhelming\, particularly Rey whom I liked in "Force Awakens". (She is now a fully-fledged Mary Sue)
The character of Luke Skywalker is completely disrespected and doesn't line up with previous iterations whatsoever.
This killed the movie for me\, which is a shame since Mark Hamill's acting is spot-on.
Inconsistencies with "the force" greatly undermines its mystery.
Awful implementation of social and political messaging at the expense of good character-development.

The movie has great visuals and effects (Mary Poppins aside)\, that deserves a star

The prequels nearly destroyed Star Wars\, "The Last Jedi" finally succeeded.
